climbs.name: Warm Beer
climbs.fa: Don Reyes, Dave Cox, Milt Jones, April 2004

content.description: Nice little route with some loose sections that will no doubt clean up nicely over time. Some stemming and jamming.
content.protection: Will take some larger pro to 4 inches.
content.location: The obvious curving crack system splitting Vector Rock.

content.description: Close bolting protects hard moves off the starting boulder, exiting the flake crack above, some may complain about the tight bolting, the first ascenders added a bolt here after a 20ft fall and near miss onto the ledge. Continuous but easier climbing to the top,still no give away until you clip the rap anchors.
content.location: On the arete left of Vector, scramble up blocks to the first bolt or climb the 5.7 crack, a 3" cam required for alternate crack start.

content.description: Begin at the base of an obvious right-arching crack that narrows to a seam just below the top. Initially the climbing is easy in the hand sized crack but quickly becomes more demanding as the crack narrows to finger width. The sustained crux section is protected by #00 - #1 TCU's or small stoppers / brass. Technical footwork on thin edges and stamina is necessary to place gear. A committing mantle move (5.10-) out of the seam to the top adds excitement to this J-Tree classic! The descent is a walk off to the east down a gully system with several ledges.
content.protection: This beautiful crack / face climb requires many cams to 2.5"  - especially 1/2" to 1". Very small to medium stopper placements also exist. Two bolts with hangers can be used to set up a belay at the top.
